descript.abstract: City zoning districts and classifications with annotation. Continually updated
descript.purpose: The areal extent of the various zoning districts is defined by this coverage.

citeinfo.origin: City Planning Commission (PCPC) Department - GIS Division

pubinfo.publish: City Planning Commission (PCPC) Department - GIS Division

procstep.procdesc: Hard-copy zoning maps were created in the early 1960's. In 1993, ESRI automated these maps. Upon receipt of these data sets, PCPC updated them to current status. Subsequently, the data set has been updated as changes have occurred.

cntperp.cntorg: Philadelphia City Planning Commission - GIS Division

altsys.altenc: Explicit elevation coordinate included with horizontal coordinates

enttyp.enttypds: Philadelphia City Planning Commission (PCPC) Department - GIS Division

attrdomv.udom: Sequential unique whole numbers that are automatically generated.

attr.attrdef: Area of feature in internal units squared.

attrdomv.udom: Positive real numbers that are automatically generated.

enttyp.enttypds: Philadelphia City Planning Commission (PCPC) Department - GIS Division

attr.attrdef: Linework, which is not district boundaries, added to the coverage for cartographic purposes (I.e. shorelines, travelways, etc. . .).

overview.eaover: Zoning includes a polygon and an arc attribute table.
overview.eadetcit: The .aat includes the 'usual' geographic attributes, as well as a code for certain line work. The .pat includes zone codes, as well as the 'usual' geographic attributes.

cntorgp.cntorg: City of Philadelphia - Non-Commercial Data Distribution Committee

distinfo.distliab: This dataset contains errors that are an artifact of the interpretation, source material and conversion process. The data and documentation are provided "as is." The City of Philadelphia (CITY) makes no warranty or representation, either express or implied, with respect to the data or accompanying documentation, including its quality, performance or accuracy. The CITY will not be liable for any direct, indirect, special, incidental, or consequential damages arising out of the use or inability to use the data or any accompanying documentation. The CITY is working to correct errors found in its datasets. Users discovering errors or making corrections to the data are requested to report such errors to the CITY at 215-686-5031 or e-mail to marion.storey@phila.gov

onlinopt.accinstr: Will e-mail or FTP to a City agency upon request.
